titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

did.repository: University of Delaware Special Collections Department Morris Library, 181 South College Avenue Newark, DE 19717-5267

bioghist.p: The Delaware Theatre Company is a cultural, educational, and community-service organization which was founded in Wilmington, Delaware, in 1978. Cleveland Morris served as the artistic director from the theater's inception until his retirement in 1998. Delaware Theatre Company is the Brandywine Valley's only resident professional theater company.

scopecontent.p: The Delaware Theater Company records document the production of and publicity for plays and the theater's board of directors and its business office. Materials include: season programs, playbills, and posters; production records including scripts, blocking charts, cue sheets, and props lists; stage manager's reports; box office statements and other financial information; marketing and publicity materials; contracts and agreements; reviews; minutes and correspondence of the board of directors; resources for grants and fundraising information; community outreach project proposals; and architect's sketches and blueprints. The collection also includes correspondence with patrons, donors, and members of the press.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

otherfindaid.p: An inventory is available in the repository.
A paper finding aid is available in the repository.

relatedmaterial.p: Related material may be found in the following collections: University of Delaware: Cleveland Morris Papers Related to the Delaware Theatre Company.
